channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication)

item.title: CVE-2022-4148|2024-08-03T01:27:54.502Z -- unknown -- wp%20oauth%20server%20%28oauth%20authentication%29
item.description: The WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication) WordPress plugin before 4.3.0 has a flawed CSRF and authorisation check when deleting a client, which could allow any authenticated users, such as subscriber to delete arbitrary client.

item.title: CVE-2022-3892|2024-08-03T01:20:58.441Z -- unknown -- wp%20oauth%20server%20%28oauth%20authentication%29
item.description: The WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication) WordPress plugin before 4.2.2 does not sanitize and escape Client IDs, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2022-3926|2024-08-03T01:27:53.908Z -- unknown -- wp%20oauth%20server%20%28oauth%20authentication%29
item.description: The WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication) WordPress plugin before 3.4.2 does not have CSRF check when regenerating secrets, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins regenerate the secret of an arbitrary client given they know the client ID

item.title: CVE-2022-3894|2024-08-03T01:20:58.779Z -- unknown -- wp%20oauth%20server%20%28oauth%20authentication%29
item.description: The WP OAuth Server (OAuth Authentication) WordPress plugin before 4.2.5 does not have CSRF check when deleting a client, and does not ensure that the object to be deleted is actually a client, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin delete arbitrary client and post via a CSRF attack.
